|archivedate=January 2, 2014 |df= }} ==Home media release== A [[DVD]] of the special was released on December 17, 2013,{{Cite news|url=http://www.broadwayworld.com/article/NBC-to-Release-THE-SOUND-OF-MUSIC-LIVE-on-DVD-Dec-17-20131123|title= NBC to Release THE SOUND OF MUSIC LIVE! on DVD, Dec 17|accessdate=November 25, 2013|work=Broadway World|publisher=Wisdom Digital Media|author=BWW News Desk|date=November 23, 2013}} through [[Universal Studios Home Entertainment]]. The DVD includes a behind-the-scenes look, titled "The Making of ''The Sound of Music Live!''"{{cite news|title='Slo 'Mo', Holi-GAYS, amd [sic] Sound of Music Live!' DVD coming up|url=http://www.windycitymediagroup.com/lgbt/Slo-Mo-Holi-GAYS-amd-Sound-of-Music-Live-DVD-coming-up/45467.html|accessdate=December 14, 2013|newspaper=Windy City Times|publisher=Windy City Media Group|publication-place=Chicago, IL|date=December 10, 2013}} and a preview of the soundtrack.''The Sound of Music Live!'' [[DVD]]. 2013. [[Universal Studios Home Entertainment]]. Main Menu. It was released on DVD in Canada on January 7, 2014.{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.ca/Sound-Music-Live-Bilingual/dp/B00FX7FC30/|title=The Sound of Music - Live (Bilingual): Carrie Underwood, Stephen Moyer, Neil Meron;Craig Zadan: DVD|publisher=[[Amazon.com]] (Canada), Amazon.com, Inc|accessdate=December 24, 2013}} ==See also== {{Portal|Musical Theatre|Television in the United States}} * [[2013 in American television]] * ''[[Peter Pan Live!]]'' (2014), NBC * ''[[The Sound of Music Live (2015)|''The Sound of Music Live'' (2015)]]'', UK TV production * ''[[The Wiz Live!]]'' (2015), NBC * ''[[Hairspray Live!]]'' (2016), NBC * ''[[Grease: Live]]'' (2016), Fox * ''[[A Christmas Story Live!]]'' (2017), Fox * ''[[Jesus Christ Superstar Live in Concert]]'' (2018), NBC * ''[[Rent: Live]]'' (2019), Fox * ''[[Hair Live!]]'' (2019), NBC ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.nbc.com/sound-of-music/}} * {{IMDb title|3141866|The Sound of Music Live!}} *{{rottentomatoes|the_sound_of_music_live}} *{{metacritic television|the-sound-of-music-live!}} {{NBC Live!}} {{Rodgers and Hammerstein}} {{The Story of the Trapp Family Singers}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sound of Music Live!}} [[Category:2010s American television specials]] [[Category:2013 television specials]] [[Category:English-language television programs]] [[Category:Live television programs]] [[Category:Musical television films]] [[Category:Musical television specials]] [[Category:NBC television specials]] [[Category:The Sound of Music]] [[Category:Television programs based on plays]] [[Category:Television remakes of films]] [[Category:Television shows filmed in New York (state)]] [[Category:Television shows set in Austria]] [[Category:Trapp family]] [[Category:Works based on actual events]]

page.title: Types of fiction with multiple endings

revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=February 2018}}
'''Multiple endings''' refer to a case in entertainment where the story could end in different ways.
==Comics== * ''[[The Death-Ray]]'' by [[Daniel Clowes]]. * ''[[Cliff Hanger (comic strip)|Cliff Hanger]]''.<ref> by [[Jack Edward Oliver]]. {{cite book|last=Oliver|first=Jack Edward|title=Buster|date=25 June 1983|publisher=Fleetway}}</ref>
==Literature== * The ''[[Choose Your Own Adventure]]'' series. * ''[[Life's Lottery]]''
==Theater==
*[[Ayn Rand]]'s 1934 play ''[[Night of January 16th]]'' allowed the audience to affect the ending by acting as the "jury" and voting the defendant "innocent" or "guilty".<ref>{{cite book |ref=harv |title=[[The Passion of Ayn Rand]] |last=Branden |first=Barbara |authorlink=Barbara Branden |location=Garden City, New York |publisher=Doubleday & Company |year=1986 |isbn=0-385-19171-5 |oclc=12614728 |pages=122–124}}</ref> *The 1985 musical ''[[The Mystery of Edwin Drood (musical)|The Mystery of Edwin Drood]]''. *[[Dario Fo]]'s 1970 play, ''[[Accidental Death of an Anarchist]]''. *The long-running play ''[[Shear Madness]]'' has multiple, audience-selected endings
==Films== DVDs may include an [[alternate ending]] as a special feature. These are usually not considered [[canon (fiction)|canon]].
Films which include multiple endings within the main cut of the film:
*''[[Clue (film)|Clue]]'' *''[[Wayne's World (film)|Wayne's World]]'' and its sequel, ''[[Wayne's World 2]]'' *''[[Scarface (1932 film)|Scarface]]'' *''[[Sliding Doors]]'' *''[[Run Lola Run]]'' *''[[Harikrishnans]]'' *''[[28 Days Later]]''
==Animation== *''[[Dragon's Lair]]'' and ''[[Space Ace]]'' *The [[Red vs. Blue (season 5)|fifth season]] finale of the [[Rooster Teeth]] web-series, ''[[Red vs. Blue]]''
==Video games== {{see also|Nonlinear gameplay}} {{see also|Category:Video games with alternate endings}}
